title: CMOC Group Shares Rally After Record First-Half Earnings
description: CMOC Group Shares Rally After Record First-Half Earnings
content:
CMOC Group shares surged after the company posted record earnings for the first half of the year.

The Chinese mining company's Hong Kong-listed shares rose as much as 11.5% to HK$12.03 on Monday, while its Shanghai-listed shares gained as much as 8.5% to 12.05 yuan. Both have since pared some gains, last trading at HK$11.87 and 11.86 yuan, respectively.

Net profit for the first half climbed 60% from a year earlier to 8.67 billion yuan, equivalent to $1.21 billion, CMOC said Friday.

Higher metal prices and stronger copper sales volumes boosted the company's results, Citi analysts said in a note.

Following the first-half results, the Citi analysts raised their net profit forecasts for 2025-2027, and revised up their H-share and A-share target prices to HK$13.40 from HK$11.20 and 12.60 yuan from 10.60 yuan, respectively.

U.S. rate-cut expectations are likely to support copper equity sentiment in the near term, Citi said, opening a 90-day positive catalyst watch on the company's Hong Kong- and China-listed shares.

"In addition, we expect CMOC could beat its copper production guidance of 600,000-660,000 tons in 2025, considering strong operations in [the first half]," Citi added.
summary: Chinese mining company, CMOC Group, has seen a surge in its shares after reporting record earnings for the first half of the year. The company's net profit for the year was 60% higher than the previous year and boosted by higher metal prices and increased copper sales volumes. Following the results, Citi analysts have raised their net profit forecasts for 2025-2027 and revised up their H-share and A-share target prices. They also predict that the company could exceed its copper production guidance of 600,000-660,000 tons in 2025.
shortSummary: CMOC Group shares surged after posting a record first-half earnings, driven by higher metal prices and stronger copper sales, but later declined.
argos_summary: CMOC Group’s Hong Kong‑listed shares jumped 11.5% after the company reported a 60% rise in first‑half net profit to 8.67 billion yuan ($1.21 billion), driven by higher metal prices and stronger copper sales. Citi analysts lifted 2025‑27 profit forecasts and raised target prices for both H‑share and A‑share listings. The bank also opened a 90‑day positive catalyst watch, citing U.S. rate‑cut expectations that could buoy copper equity sentiment. Citi predicts CMOC will likely exceed its 2025 copper production guidance of 600,000‑660,000 tons.
